meanings.definition: Not able to be moved or changed.
meanings.sent1: The heavy boulder was immovable, no matter how hard we tried to push it.
meanings.sent2: The ancient statue stood immovable in the courtyard, unaffected by the passing of time.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn cat remained immovable in front of the closed door, demanding to be let in.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quit her job was as immovable as a mountain, nothing could sway her.
meanings.sent5: The giant oak tree's roots were so immovable, they seemed to anchor it to the ground forever.

meanings.sent1: The signpost was immovable, guiding travelers along the correct path.
meanings.sent2: The old lighthouse stood immovable on the rocky cliff, warning ships of danger.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's toy car got stuck immovable under the heavy cabinet, causing a mini traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty to his friends was as immovable as the North Star, always there to guide them.
meanings.sent5: The castle gates were so immovable, even the strongest knights struggled to open them.

meanings.sent1: Despite the storm, the captain remained immovable in his decision to sail on.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's immovable dedication to her students inspired them to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The immovable belief in magic led the children to search for fairies in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her faith in herself was as immovable as a rock, never wavering in times of doubt.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's immovable courage in battle earned him the respect of his comrades.
